name: Dynamics365DataImporter
description: Dynamics 365 Data Importer using Capgemini.Xrm.DataMigration Engine.
author: capgemini-uk

inputs.name: jsonFolderPath
inputs.label: JSON Folderpath
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folderpath to the exported JSON files to be imported.

inputs.name: connectionString
inputs.label: Connection String
inputs.helpMarkDown: ConnectionString to Dynamics 365 instance. [Microsoft Connection String Guide](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-engagement/developer/xrm-tooling/use-connection-strings-xrm-tooling-connect#create-a-connection-string)

inputs.name: maxThreads
inputs.label: Max Threads
inputs.helpMarkDown: Maximum threads to be used during import.

inputs.name: savePageSize
inputs.label: ExecuteMultiple Batch Size
inputs.helpMarkDown: The maximum number of records for each ExecuteMultiple request. Dynamics 365 default maximum is 1000.

inputs.name: ignoreSystemFields
inputs.label: Ignore System Fields
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag that determines whether system fields should be ignored.

inputs.name: ignoreStatuses
inputs.label: Ignore Status Fields
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag that determines whether status fields should be ignored.

inputs.name: useCsv
inputs.label: Use CSV
inputs.helpMarkDown: Flag that determines if the import is to use CSV files instead of JSON.

inputs.name: schemaFilePath
inputs.label: Schema File Path (for CSV Import only)
inputs.helpMarkDown: If 'Use CSV' is ticked, the filpath to the schema.

inputs.name: configFilePath
inputs.label: Import Config Filepath
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional: Filepath to Import Config file.

inputs.name: csvFilesToImport
inputs.label: CSV Files to Import
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can assign either 'CSV Files to Import' or 'Import File Filter' or neither, but not both.

inputs.name: filesFilter
inputs.label: Import File Filter
inputs.helpMarkDown: You can assign either 'CSV Files to Import' or 'Import File Filter' or neither, but not both.

inputs.name: treatWarningsAsErrors
inputs.label: Treat Warnings as Errors
inputs.helpMarkDown: A flag to determine whether warnings should be treated as errors.
